treeObjects
The function returns a collection of
hierarchical object types
down the hierarchy from the specified node.
Syntax
treeObjects
(typeObj, [rootNode], rootNodeInCollection, [useDepthPath])
Setting
Purpose
typeObj
Object type represented by the hierarchy.
rootNode
Root node - a tree node in the form of an instance of this object type (used optionally).
Parameter is used optionally. If the root node is not selected (null is specified), then all objects of the specified type will be added to the collection.
rootNodeInCollection
Boolean parameter (true/false) that determines the calculation on the specified root node.
useDepthPath
Boolean parameter (
true/false
) that determines the sorting of the resulting collection of objects, specifically:
if the parameter value is
true
, the objects will be sorted
by hierarchy branches
(child objects will be grouped under their respective parent), and then by ascending Object IDs;
if the parameter value is
false
, the objects will be sorted
by hierarchy levels
(from top to bottom), and then by ascending Object IDs.
This parameter is optional. If not specified, the default value is true.
Note
The function is called from the
"Objects" tab
of the algorithm editor’s toolbar.
A modal window is displayed, requiring the following actions:
in the "Object type" field, select a
hierarchical object type
;
in the "Root node" field, specify the object (node) from which the collection will include objects located lower in the hierarchy;
use the "Include root node in collection" parameter to define whether to add the specified node to the collection.
Use example
To obtain a list of departments in France that belong to the Île-de-France region, the system object type
"Region"
is used, which is intended for storing country region lists.
The following algorithm structure is proposed:
When writing the algorithm, the treeObjects function is called. During its configuration, the object type "Region" is selected, and the root node "Île-de-France" is specified, which will be added to the collection.
The output of the resulting object collection to the algorithm log is performed using the
printout
function through a loop over the object collection with the
forEach
function. The "Name" attribute is specified using the
attrByVar
function.
